result.execSummary:
The defendant Mackenzie L Helmuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
-Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
-Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant Mackenzie L Helmuth in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Mackenzie L Helmuth. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Per ADA Bolz - state has complied w/victim-witness notice.
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters N/C plea re: Ct. 2.
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty re: Ct. 2; Ct. 1 - dismissed & read-in.
Statements by ADA Bolz and Atty. Slattery.
Court orders sentence withheld 2 yrs probation.  Conditions of probation as follows:
-defendant pay costs/supervision fees
-Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
-Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
-Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment. 
Defendant provided with Notice of Appeal Rights.

Plea accepted on both counts. 
Bond continued.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
